0.question:
The specific rate constant, k, for a certain first-order reaction is 86 h^-1. What mass of a 0.0500 g sample of starting material will remain after 58 s?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.0500 g
B. 0.0250 g
C. 0.0125 g
D. 0.00625 g
Answer: 2

Calculate the Q-factor for an X-band EPR cavity with a resonator bandwidth of 1.58 MHz.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Q = 1012
B. Q = 2012
C. Q = 3012
D. Q = 6012
Answer: 3

What is the ionization constant, Ka, for a weak monoprotic acid if a 0.060 molar solution has a pH of 2.0?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2.0 × 10^-3
B. 2.0 × 10^-1
C. 1.7 × 10^-1
D. 5.0 × 10^-3
Answer: 0

Calculate the equilibrium polarization of 13C nuclei in a 20.0 T magnetic field at 300 K.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 10.8 x 10^-5
B. 4.11 x 10^-5
C. 3.43 x 10^-5
D. 1.71 x 10^-5
Answer:

1.question:
Which of the following should be named using Roman numerals after the cation?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CaCl2
B. CuCl2
C. AlBr3
D. K2Cr2O7
Answer: 1

What is the mass of one molecule of cholesterol (C27H46O, molecular mass = 386)?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 6.41 × 10^-22 g
B. 1.5 × 10^-21 g
C. 1.38 × 10^-21 g
D. 3 × 10^-23 g
Answer: 0

The dissociation energy for a hydrogen-bromine bond is defined as the change in enthalpy, DH, for which of the following reactions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2 HBr(g) → H2(g) + Br2(l)
B. HBr(g) → H+(g) + Br−(g)
C. H(g) + Br(g) → HBr(g)
D. HBr(g) → H(g) + Br(g)
Answer: 3

The 99Ru chemical shift of [Ru(H2O)6]2+ is 16,050 ppm relative to [Ru(CN)6]2- at 0 ppm. The electronic excitation energies of [Ru(H2O)6]2+, [Ru(CN)6]2- and [Ru(NH3)6]2+ are 18,900, 40,000 and 25,600 cm-1 respectively. Assuming that the chemical shift differences are dominated by paramagnetic currents, determine the chemical shift of [Ru(NH3)6]2+.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 7,530 ppm
B. 8,090 ppm
C. 11,070 ppm
D. 14,840 ppm
Answer:

2.question:
Nickel (Z = 28, A = 59) has a first ionization energy of 737 kJ/mol and a boiling point of 2913 °C, while Pt (Z = 78, A = 195) has a first ionization energy of 870 kJ/mol and a boiling point of 3825 °C. Which of the following are the most reasonable values of ionization energy and boiling point for palladium?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. -200 kJ/mol and 3524 °C
B. 795 kJ/mol and 2436 °C
C. 804 kJ/mol and 2963 °C
D. 932 kJ/mol and 3416 °C
Answer: 2

Suppose that the 13C nuclei in a molecule in a 600 MHz spectrometer can be 100% polarized (p = 1). If T1 = 5.0 s, how long does it take for p to reach a value equal to twice the thermal equilibrium polarization at 298 K?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. [The polarization relaxes exponentially: p(t) = [p(0) - peq]exp(-t/T1) + peq.]
B. 72.0 s
C. 56.6 s
D. 12.7 s
Answer: 1

The molecule with a tetrahedral shape is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. PCl4F
B. BF3
C. CO2
D. CBr4
Answer: 3

A single line is seen in the 31P spectrum of a solution of sodium phosphate. The 31P chemical shifts of H2PO4‾ and HPO42– are 3.42 ppm and 5.82 ppm respectively. What is the chemical shift when the pH of the solution equals the pKa of H2PO4‾?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.41 ppm
B. 3.98 ppm
C. 4.33 ppm
D. 4.62 ppm
Answer:

3.question:
Which of the following is expected to have the largest bond polarity?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. S–O
B. P–F
C. C–B
D. C–N
Answer: 1

The rate of a chemical reaction is determined by
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. the equilibrium constant
B. the rate-determining or slow step of the mechanism
C. the reaction vessel pressure
D. the intermediates formed in the first step
Answer: 1

Calculate the Larmor frequency for a proton in a magnetic field of 1 T.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 23.56 GHz
B. 42.58 MHz
C. 74.34 kHz
D. 13.93 MHz
Answer: 1

Of the following ions, which has the smallest radius?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. K+
B. Ca2+
C. Sc3+
D. Rb+
Answer:

4.question:
A solution contains a mixture of four different compounds: KCl(aq), Fe(NO3)3(aq), MgSO4(aq), and N2H4(aq). Which of these compounds would be easiest to separate via distillation?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. KCl(aq)
B. Fe(NO3)3(aq)
C. MgSO4 (aq)
D. N2H4(aq)
Answer: 3

A solution is prepared by dissolving 30.0 grams of Ni(NO3)2 in enough water to make 250 mL of solution. What is the molarity of this solution?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.496 molar
B. 0.656 mol/L
C. 3.3 molar
D. 6.3 × 10^-3 molar
Answer: 1

Which of the following must be true about a binary liquid mixture that obeys Raoult’s law?
I. The partial pressure of each component at equilibrium is proportional to its mole fraction in the liquid mixture.
II. The volume of the mixture is equal to the sum of the volumes of each component before mixing.
III. Intermolecular interactions in the mixture are identical to intermolecular interactions in the pure components.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. I only
B. III only
C. I and III only
D. I, II, and III
Answer: 3

Which of the following compounds has a 1H resonance approximately 1.55 kHz away from TMS on a spectrometer with a 12.0 T magnet?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH3F
B. CH3Cl
C. CH3Br
D. CH3I
Answer:

5.question:
Hydrogen fluoride, HF, is a liquid at 15°C. All other hydrogen halides (represented by HX, where X is any other halogen) are gases at the same temperature. Why?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Fluorine has a very high electronegativity; therefore the H-F bond is stronger than any other H-X bond.
B. HF is smaller than any other H-X molecule; therefore it exhibits stronger London dispersion forces.
C. The dipoles in a HF molecule exhibit a particularly strong attraction force to the dipoles in other HF molecules.
D. The H-F bond is the most ionic in character compared to all other hydrogen halides.
Answer: 2

Of the following compounds, which has the lowest melting point?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HCl
B. AgCl
C. CaCl2
D. CCl4
Answer: 0

A sample of oxygen gas at 50 °C is heated, reaching a final temperature of 100 °C. Which statement best describes the behavior of the gas molecules?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Their velocity increases by a factor of two.
B. Their velocity increases by a factor of four.
C. Their kinetic energy increases by a factor of 2.
D. Their kinetic energy increases by a factor of less than 2.
Answer: 3

Which of the following statements most accurately explains why the 1H spectrum of 12CHCl3 is a singlet?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Both 35Cl and 37Cl have I = 0.
B. The hydrogen atom undergoes rapid intermolecular exchange.
C. The molecule is not rigid.
D. Both 35Cl and 37Cl have electric quadrupole moments.
Answer:

6.question:
A 25 g sample of a liquid was heated to 100 °C and then quickly transferred to an insulated container holding 100 g of water at 22 °C. The temperature of the mixture rose to reach a final temperature of 35 °C. Which of the following can be concluded?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the sample lost more heat energy than the water gained.
B. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did, but the sample lost the same amount of heat energy as the water gained.
C. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the CP of the sample must be greater than the CP of the water.
D. The final temperature is less than the average starting temperature of the sample and the water; therefore the total energy of the sample and water decreased.
Answer: 1

Joseph Priestly discovered oxygen gas by the decomposition of solid mercury(II) oxide, HgO, to oxygen gas, O2, and liquid mercury metal, Hg. How many moles of oxygen gas will form when 4.32 g of solid mercury(II) oxide decomposes? The formula mass of mercury(II) oxide is 216 g mol^-1.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.100 mol
B. 0.0100 mol
C. 0.0200 mol
D. 0.0150 mol
Answer: 1

Which of the following compounds has a 1H resonance approximately 1.55 kHz away from TMS on a spectrometer with a 12.0 T magnet?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH3F
B. CH3Cl
C. CH3Br
D. CH3I
Answer: 1

Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) such as F3CCCl3 are implicated in the decomposition of stratospheric ozone. Which of the following methods would be best suited to measurement of trace amounts (sub-ppb) of CFCs in an air sample?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Gas chromatographic separation of the air sample on a capillary column followed by electron capture detection
B. Gas chromatographic separation of the air sample on a packed column followed by thermal conductivity detection
C. Gas chromatographic separation of the air sample on a capillary column followed by flame ionization detection
D. Conversion of the sample of the chlorinated compounds to chloride ions, followed by titration with Ag+
Answer:

7.question:
A single line is seen in the 31P spectrum of a solution of sodium phosphate. The 31P chemical shifts of H2PO4‾ and HPO42– are 3.42 ppm and 5.82 ppm respectively. What is the chemical shift when the pH of the solution equals the pKa of H2PO4‾?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.41 ppm
B. 3.98 ppm
C. 4.33 ppm
D. 4.62 ppm
Answer: 3

A 25 g sample of a liquid was heated to 95 °C and then quickly transferred to an insulated container holding 100 g of water at 26 °C. The temperature of the mixture rose to reach a final temperature of 37 °C. Which of the following can be concluded?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The sample lost more heat energy than the water gained because the sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did.
B. The final temperature is less than the average starting temperatures; therefore the equilibrium constant must be less than 1.
C. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the heat capacity of the sample must be greater than the heat capacity of the water.
D. Even though the sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did, the sample lost the same amount of heat energy as the water gained to obey the law of conservation of energy.
Answer: 3

Which is correct about the calcium atom?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It contains 20 protons and neutrons
B. It contains 20 protons and 20 electrons
C. It contains 20 protons, neutrons, and electrons
D. All atoms of calcium have a mass of 40.078 u
Answer: 1

Which of the following metal ions cannot be used as a paramagnetic quencher?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Ti3+
B. Cr3+
C. Fe3+
D. Zn2+
Answer:

8.question:
Of the following oxo acids, which is predicted to be the strongest acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HBrO
B. HClO
C. HIO
D. HClO3
Answer: 3

What is the ionization constant, Ka, for a weak monoprotic acid if a 0.060 molar solution has a pH of 2.0?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2.0 × 10^-3
B. 2.0 × 10^-1
C. 1.7 × 10^-1
D. 5.0 × 10^-3
Answer: 0

The molecular geometry of thionyl chloride, SOCl2, is best described as
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. trigonal planar
B. T-shaped
C. tetrahedral
D. trigonal pyramidal
Answer: 3

A molecule has a rotational correlation time of 1 ns. At what magnetic field would protons in this molecule have the fastest spin-lattice relaxation? [Use eqns 5.3 and 5.4.]
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.74 T
B. 5.19 T
C. 6.08 T
D. 9.49 T
Answer:

9.question:
The first ionization energy for a neutral atom of chlorine is 1.25 MJ/mol and the first ionization energy for a neutral atom of argon is 1.52 MJ/mol. How would the first ionization energy value for a neutral atom of potassum compare to those values?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It would be greater than both because potassium carries a greater nuclear charge then either chlorine or argon.
B. It would be greater than both because the size of a potassium atom is smaller than an atom of either chlorine or argon.
C. It would be less than both because there are more electrons in potassium, meaning they repel each other more effectively and less energy is needed to remove one.
D. It would be less than both because a valence electron of potassium is farther from the nucleus than one of either chlorine or argon.
Answer: 3

The 13C spectrum of which isomer of C6H14 has lines with five distinct chemical shifts?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. hexane
B. 2-methylpentane
C. 3-methylpentane
D. 2,3-dimethylbutane
Answer: 1

How many moles of propane (C3H8) are there in 6.2 g of propane?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 14.1 mol
B. 1.4 × 10^-1 mol
C. 71 mol
D. 7.1 mol
Answer: 1

The X-band (9.5 GHz) EPR spectrum of a matrix isolated Na atom reveals four hyperfine lines with resonant field positions of 3074 G, 3174 G, 3274 G and 3374 G. Calculate the g value of the atom.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. g = 2.002
B. g = 1.950
C. g = 2.250
D. g = 2.005
Answer:

10.question:
What is the work involved if a gas in a 2.0-liter container at 2.4 atmospheres pressure is allowed to expand against a pressure of 0.80 atmosphere?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. -3.2 L atm
B. -9.62 L atm
C. -4.8 L atm
D. +14.4 L atm
Answer: 0

All proteins absorb electromagnetic radiation of wavelength around 190 nm, which corresponds to a π → π* excitation in the protein molecule. In which region of the spectrum is this wavelength found?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. X-ray
B. Ultraviolet
C. Visible
D. Infrared
Answer: 1

A 2.0 L flask holds 0.40 g of helium gas. If the helium is evacuated into a larger container while the temperature is held constant, what will the effect on the entropy of the helium be?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It will remain constant as the number of helium molecules does not change.
B. It will decrease as the gas will be more ordered in the larger flask.
C. It will decrease because the molecules will collide with the sides of the larger flask less often than they did in the smaller flask.
D. It will increase as the gas molecules will be more dispersed in the larger flask.
Answer: 3

The number of allowed energy levels for the 55Mn nuclide are:
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3
B. 5
C. 8
D. 4
Answer:

11.question:
Which of the following is lower for argon than for neon?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Melting point
B. Boiling point
C. Polarizability
D. First ionization energy
Answer: 3

Carbon exists in various forms called allotropes. Which of the following is not an allotrope of carbon?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. diamond
B. soot
C. buckminsterfullerene
D. graphite
Answer: 1

Which of the following is expected to have two or more resonance structures?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CCl2F2
B. SO3
C. PF5
D. H2O
Answer: 1

Which of the following is a true statement about optical isomerism of complexes containing achiral ligands?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Square planar complexes can display optical isomerism only if all four ligands are identical.
B. Tetrahedral complexes never display optical isomerism.
C. Linear complexes can display optical isomerism when both ligands are different.
D. Octahedral complexes of monodentate ligands can display optical isomerism only when they have at least three different ligands.
Answer:

Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. BeCl2
B. MgCl2
C. ZnCl2
D. SCl2
Answer: 3

Most transition metals share a common oxidation state of +2. Which of the following best explains why?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Transition metals all have a minimum of two unpaired electrons.
B. Transition metals have unstable configurations and are very reactive.
C. Transition metals tend to gain electrons when reacting with other elements.
D. Transition metals will lose their outermost s-block electrons when forming bonds.
Answer: 3

Which of the following has an octet of electrons around the central atom?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. BF3
B. NH4+
C. PF5
D. SF6
Answer: 1

A substance that is NOT generally considered to be a toxic pollutant in water is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. carbonic acid
B. a halogenated hydrocarbon
C. lead
D. mercury

Choose the best answer from the following options:

B. very electronegative

D. highly colored

Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HCl / NaOH
B. H3O+ / H2O
C. O2 / H2O
D. H+ / Cl−

Choose the best answer from the following options:

D. H2O
Answer: 1

The molecular geometry of thionyl chloride, SOCl2, is best described as
Choose the best answer from the following options:

A mechanism is a sequence of elementary reactions that add up to the overall reaction stoichiometry. A substance that is produced in one elementary reaction and consumed in another is called
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. a catalyst
B. an intermediate
C. a reactant
D. a complex
Answer: 1

Of the following compounds, which is LEAST likely to behave as a Lewis acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. BeCl2
B. MgCl2
C. ZnCl2
D. SCl2
Answer: 3

Chemical reactions can be classified as either heterogeneous or homogeneous. Which of the following equations below is best classified as a heterogeneous reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2C2H2(g) + 5O2(g) → 4CO2(g) + 2H2O(g)
B. C2H5OH(aq) + O2(aq) → HC2H3O2(aq) + H2O(aq)
C. C(s) + H2O(g) → H2(g) + CO(g)
D. C2H2(g) + 5N2O(g) → CO2(g) + H2O(g) + 5N2(g)
Answer: 2

B. Atomic size trends within the periodic table

Which of the following is lower for argon than for neon?

A silyl radical bearing an Si-H· fragment has a g value of 2.0033 and a pair of lines separated by 15.5 MHz. Express the splitting in units of mT, Gauss and cm-1.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 15.5 MHz = 11.104 mT = 27.201 Gauss = 0.862 x 10^-4 cm-1
B. 15.5 MHz = 7.352 mT = 10.104 Gauss = 18.39 x 10^-4 cm-1
C. 15.5 MHz = 1.55 mT = 0.562 Gauss = 31.0 x 10^-4 cm-1

Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1.0 × 10^−3
B. 1.0 × 10^−6
C. 1.0 × 10^−9

The Arrhenius equation may be used to determine
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. the activation energy of a reaction
B. the rate constant at various temperatures
C. the shelf life of a consumer product or drug
D. all of the above
Answer: 3

A solution of a weak base is titrated with a solution of a standard strong acid. The progress of the titration is followed with a pH meter. Which of the following observations would occur?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Initially, the pH slowly decreases, then there is a rapid decrease to give a pH below 7 at the equivalence point.
B. The pH of the solution gradually decreases throughout the experiment and the pH at the equivalence point is below 7.
C. Initially, the pH slowly decreases, then there is a rapid decrease to give a pH equal to 7 at the equivalence point.
D. Initially, the pH quickly decrease, then there is a gradual decrease to the equivalence point where the pOH equals the pKb of the base.
Answer: 0

B. ΔJ = 1; Δu = 0
C. ΔJ = 2; Δu = 0
D. ΔJ = 1; Δu = 1

A. 3.02 ppm
B. 5.03 ppm

Hydrogen fluoride, HF, is a liquid at 15°C. All other hydrogen halides (represented by HX, where X is any other halogen) are gases at the same temperature. Why?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Fluorine has a very high electronegativity; therefore the H-F bond is stronger than any other H-X bond.
B. HF is smaller than any other H-X molecule; therefore it exhibits stronger London dispersion forces.
C. The dipoles in a HF molecule exhibit a particularly strong attraction force to the dipoles in other HF molecules.
D. The H-F bond is the most ionic in character compared to all other hydrogen halides.
Answer: 2

Choose the best answer from the following options:

A. 53.0 g/mol
B. 46.7 g/mol
C. 4.67 g/mol
D. 2876 g/mol

Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Tetrahedron
B. Square planar
C. Octahedron
D. Square pyramid
Answer: 3

Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.5 T
B. 1.2 T
C. 2.9 T
D. 100 T
Answer: 2

Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. nα = nβeq and nβ = nαeq
B. nα = nαeq and nβ = nβeq
C. nα = ½(nαeq + nβeq) and nβ = ½(nαeq + nβeq)
D. nα = nαeq + nβeq and nβ = nαeq + nβeq

20.question:
An unknown substance is found to have a high melting point. In addition, it is a poor conductor of electricity and does not dissolve in water. The substance most likely contains
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ionic bonding
B. nonpolar covalent bonding
C. covalent network bonding
D. metallic bonding
Answer: 2

A buffer is made from equal concentrations of a weak acid and its conjugate base. Doubling the volume of the buffer solution by adding water has what effect on its pH?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It has little effect.
B. It significantly increases the pH.
C. It significantly decreases the pH.
D. It changes the pH asymptotically to the pKa of the acid.
Answer: 0

The Pauli exclusion principle states that
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. no two electrons can have the same energy
B. no two electrons can have the same four quantum numbers
C. no two electrons can occupy separate orbitals
D. no two electrons can pair up if there is an empty orbital available
Answer: 1

Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. F
B. Si
C. O
D. Ca
Answer:

21.question:
During the study of the reaction A → 2B, a chemist constructs several graphs. The graph of [A] versus time and the graph of ln [A] versus time both give a curved line; however, the graph of 1/[A] versus time and gives a straight line. This implies the rate law is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Rate = k[A]
B. Rate = k[A]^2
C. Rate = k[A]^0

A. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the sample lost more heat energy than the water gained.
B. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did, but the sample lost the same amount of heat energy as the water gained.
C. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the CP of the sample must be greater than the CP of the water.
D. The final temperature is less than the average starting temperature of the sample and the water; therefore the total energy of the sample and water decreased.
Answer: 1

B. [H2SO3] > [HSO3-] > [SO32-]
C. [H2SO3] > [HSO3-] = [SO32-]
D. [SO32-] = [HSO3-] > [H2SO3]
Answer: 1

43.question:
Chemical reactions can be classified as either heterogeneous or homogeneous. Which of the following equations below is best classified as a heterogeneous reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2C2H2(g) + 5O2(g) → 4CO2(g) + 2H2O(g)
B. C2H5OH(aq) + O2(aq) → HC2H3O2(aq) + H2O(aq)
C. C(s) + H2O(g) → H2(g) + CO(g)
D. C2H2(g) + 5N2O(g) → CO2(g) + H2O(g) + 5N2(g)
Answer: 2

A. hexane
B. 2-methylpentane
C. 3-methylpentane
D. 2,3-dimethylbutane
Answer: 1

An unknown substance is found to have a high melting point. In addition, it is a poor conductor of electricity and does not dissolve in water. The substance most likely contains
Choose the best answer from the following options:

B. nonpolar covalent bonding

D. metallic bonding

47.question:
Three 25.00 mL samples of approximately 0.10 M phenol, C6H5OH, Ka = 1.0 × 10^-10 were removed from a container and placed in separate 250 mL beakers. The samples were titrated with standard potassium hydroxide, KOH, solution. Cresol red was the acid-base indicator used in the titration. The samples required 31.75, 32.38, and 41.75 mL to reach the endpoint. Which of the following might explain why one of the samples required significantly more base to reach the endpoint?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The indicator was added too late.
B. The wrong indicator was used.
C. There was a base contaminating the unclean beaker.
D. There was an acid contaminating the unclean beaker.
Answer: 3

Which of the following is (are) characteristic of mass spectrometry?
I. Analyte molecules are converted to gaseous ions.
II. The ions are separated according to their mass-to-charge ratio.
III. In addition to compound identification, mass spectra can be utilized to determine precise isotopic masses and isotopic ratios.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. II only
B. I and II only
C. I and III only
D. I, II, and III
Answer: 3

The standard state for redox reactions includes
Choose the best answer from the following options:

C. partial pressures of gases are 1 atmosphere
D. all of the above are true
Answer: 3

48.question:
Which would be the easiest way to burn a copper penny?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Hold the copper penny with crucible tongs, and heat strongly in the flame of a Bunsen burner.
B. Use the method in (A), but use an oxyacetylene torch to reach a higher temperature.
C. Grind the copper penny into very small, dust-sized particles, and spray the particles into a Bunsen burner flame.
D. Dissolve the copper penny in acid, precipitate the hydroxide, and heat in a Bunsen burner flame to make the oxide.
Answer: 2

Which of the following must be true about a binary liquid mixture that obeys Raoult’s law?
I. The partial pressure of each component at equilibrium is proportional to its mole fraction in the liquid mixture.
II. The volume of the mixture is equal to the sum of the volumes of each component before mixing.
III. Intermolecular interactions in the mixture are identical to intermolecular interactions in the pure components.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. I only
B. III only
C. I and III only
D. I, II, and III
Answer: 3

When collecting a gas over water, it is important to
Choose the best answer from the following options:

C. wait until the barometer reads 760
D. correct for the vapor pressure of water
Answer: 3

Which of the following is a true statement about optical isomerism of complexes containing achiral ligands?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Square planar complexes can display optical isomerism only if all four ligands are identical.
B. Tetrahedral complexes never display optical isomerism.
C. Linear complexes can display optical isomerism when both ligands are different.
D. Octahedral complexes of monodentate ligands can display optical isomerism only when they have at least three different ligands.
